title: Garlic-Basil Marinara Sauce
shortDescription: A marinara sauce that works all the time, using one single pot and a (not too) slow cooking time.
description: This classic marinara sauce can be ready in a little over 30 minutes and packs lot's of flavor. A must-have for your Italian themed recipes.
alt: A picture of a pot ot marinara sauce, with basil leaves, garlic, and salt scattered on a rustic table.
ingredients: 2 Tbsp olive oil (sub water if avoiding oil)
1 large can of crushed tomatoes without salt (28oz)
1/2 tablespoons of agave or maple syrup to taste - omit if avoiding sugar or use sugar if you prefer
1/4 tsp red pepper flake (reduce or increase according to spice preference)
3 teaspoons of dried basil (1/2 cup roughly chopped fresh basil - plus more for serving)
2 teaspoons of mushroom or umami powder (optional)
directions: Preheat a 5 quart pot and add the water (or olive oil) and the diced garlic. Cook until fragrant, about 5 minutes.

Add the remaining ingredients. Bring to boil and reduce the heat. Cover and simmer for about 30 minutes, stirring at every 10 minutes, or until the sauce has reduced by half. Be careful - it will splash and it can cause burns.
Note: If using fresh basil, add at the last 5 minutes. If using dried basil, add with all the other ingredients.
